summary: The Collegiate Sports Integrity Act (S. 2147) seeks to exempt intercollegiate athletic conferences and interstate intercollegiate athletic associations from antitrust laws. The bill defines relevant terms like 'antitrust laws,' 'institution of higher education,' 'intercollegiate athletic conference,' and 'interstate intercollegiate athletic association.' The core of the bill is a provision stating that antitrust laws do not apply to these entities.
